attributes.action: Allow British nationality to all who have a british born parent with no regard to the person's age
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Currently the 1981 immigration act stipulates that a person born to a mother who at the time of birth was either British by birth or naturalisation is eligible for registration as a British citizen - so long as they were born after February 1961. This is blatant discrimination on the basis of age. This makes it possible for a British resident for over 30 years through patriality to still require to go through the process of naturalisation despite younger siblings who have never even been in Britain getting British nationality - well, pretty much automatically. The reason for this abbaration is not clear and discriminatory on the basis of age.
